Package java1

Class Java1.Turtle

java.lang.Object
java1.Java1.Turtle
Enclosing class:
Java1
public class Java1.Turtle extends Object
The Turtle library provides commands to create and control a turtle, that can be moved around, drawing a line behind it.

    • LString

      public void LString(String string, double angle, int length)
      Runs a series of commands, specified by letters in a string. char to commands:
      F & G : Move forward with pen
      f : Move forwards without pen
      + : turn left
      - : turn right
      [ : push coordinates to stack (save coordinates)
      ] : pop coordinates from stack (load saved coordinates)
      Parameters:
      string - a string of characters that all symbolise different commands
      angle - the angle which all turns should be taken as
      length - the length all move commands should move forwards
      See Also:
      • move(int)
      • moveX(int)
      • turnLeft(double)
      • turnRight(double)
      • push()
      • pop()

    • Fractal

      public void Fractal(String axiom, String rules, int iterations, double angle, int length)
      Draws a fractal at the given position. Fractal takes an axiom, a base value, and then modifies it according to the specified rules. The itereations variable defines how many iterations it does. an example of how the function is rus is the following:
      turtle.Fractal("G", "F,FF,G,F[-G]++G-,[,[,+,+,-,-,],]", 8, 45, 2);
      This creates a standard binary tree fractal. For every iteration, the rules state that the character F becomes FF, G becomes F[-G]++G-, and all other characters remain the same

      For more information on LString Fractals, refer to this page

      Parameters:
      axiom - The original string, that gets modified by the values in rules
      rules - A list of In, Out; where every occurance of in becomes the out string. Example string that doesn't modify the axiom is "F,F,G,G,f,f,[,[,+,+,-,-,],]"
      iterations - The amount of iterations the fractal goes through
      angle - The angle for all turns
      length - The length of all forward moves
      See Also:
      • LString(String, double, int)
